text: <@U14S06MT7|igor> has joined the channel
<@U12AHQ3NK>: the obc repo is deprecated. Use <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: <@U0TFEHX8E>: i was thinking at some point we should start to experiment with 16.04 update, thoughts?
no specific rush, but just on the roadmap after some of the current firedrills are out of the way
no issues with that. Maybe we could try it locally for a few weeks?
Certainly.  I can make it available in a branch and share
<@U0Q6BA1EU|bobbiejc> has joined the channel
<@U0TFEHX8E> <@U0KPFAZNF> speaking of roadmaps and firedrills it would be nice if these could be documented for all to see so that community members can find out what's going on
<@U0P2GSA8Z>: i believe generally speaking that is true via the github issues
(which, btw, are much easier to follow if you have the zenhub plugin installed
but to that point, this 16.04 proposal should have an issue to track it, ill create one now
issues don't tell the whole story though
all issues are clearly not treated equally (not that they should be) and it's unclear what is being worked on and why
i agree with you, though that mechanism/fact is not something i have any control over either
im sure proposals for process improvement are just as welcome as any other, is all I can say about that
FYI, tracked above as Issue 1305
fyi, I'm an IBMer and I've been on the back of my colleagues to improve on that front for a while :wink:
ah, ok, cool
I'm part of the Open Technology group with Chris Ferris
I am not so have little say in that matter, heh
so part of my role is to help our colleagues who have less experience in working in the open to successfully transition to that mode of working
i would certainly encourage anything that helps track all of this stuff, but I dont have any suggestions on what that might be
you mentioned roadmap, I think having a published roadmap would be a good start
the tags on the issues also reveal somebody is defining sprints and selecting issues for them
how this gets done needs to be open
I know there is no lack of goodwill to do so but it will take some time
and until it's done I will keep pushing :simple_smile:
sounds good, thank you
